transcript:
propose to Alexander a meeting with Napo- leon. To the joy and pride of the whole army, a personal interview was refused, and instead of the Sovereign, Prince Dolgorukov, the vic- tor at Wischau, was sent with Savary to negoti- ate with Napoleon if, contrary to expectations, these negotiations were actuated by a real de- sire for peace. 
Toward evening Dolgorukov came back, went straight to the Tsar, and remained alone with him for a long time. 
On the eighteenth and nineteenth of No- vember,
